snippet: Apple's iOS comes with more than two dozen apps that cannot be deleted. Some apps, like Mail, are essential, but why are some nonessential apps so immovable?
abstract: Apple's iOS comes with more than two dozen apps that cannot be deleted. Some apps, like Mail, are essential, but why are some nonessential apps so immovable?

headline.main: Apps I Want to Go Away

snippet: The unlikely director of what might be the city's most progressive design institution, Archivo Diseño y Arquitectura, discusses its mission and collection.
abstract: The unlikely director of what might be the city's most progressive design institution, Archivo Diseño y Arquitectura, discusses its mission and collection.

snippet: In its keynote at the Worldwide Developers Conference in San Francisco, Apple took the wraps off enough new features and products to cover a mummy parade. Here are some further reflections on the MacBook Air, iOS 6 and Mountain Lion.
abstract: In its keynote at the Worldwide Developers Conference in San Francisco, Apple took the wraps off enough new features and products to cover a mummy parade. Here are some further reflections on the MacBook Air, iOS 6 and Mountain Lion.

headline.main: Pondering the Rest of the Apple Announcements

snippet: A week before a Senate subcommittee is set to hold hearings, two consumer-advocate organizations tried to rally opposition to the $1.9 billion acquisition with a detailed report on the deal.
abstract: A week before a Senate subcommittee is set to hold hearings, two consumer-advocate organizations tried to rally opposition to the $1.9 billion acquisition with a detailed report on the deal.

headline.main: Opposition to Universal-EMI Deal Intensifies Before Senate Hearings

snippet: Nokia will slash 19 percent of its work force by the end of 2013 as part of an emergency overhaul that includes closing research centers and a factory in Germany, Canada and Finland, and the departures of three senior executives.
abstract: Nokia will slash 19 percent of its work force by the end of 2013 as part of an emergency overhaul that includes closing research centers and a factory in Germany, Canada and Finland, and the departures of three senior executives.

snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain testifies about the relationship between the British press and government, subscriptions to Time Inc. magazines will be available via Apple's newsstand, and the inspiration of the Martin Scorsese film "Goodf...
abstract: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain testifies about the relationship between the British press and government, subscriptions to Time Inc. magazines will be available via Apple's newsstand, and the inspiration of the Martin Scorsese film "Goodfellas" died on Tuesday.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Questions for Prime Minister, and Can Bieber Ever Grow Up?

snippet: The Finnish company, struggling to restart its mobile phone business with Microsoft, also said it would post a wider loss in the second quarter.
abstract: Nokia will cut 10,000 jobs, or 19 percent of its work force, by the end of 2013 as part of an emergency overhaul; warns its loss is likely to be greater in the second quarter than it was in the first.

headline.main: Nokia to Cut 10,000 Jobs and Close 3 Facilities
headline.print_headline: Nokia, Faced With a Worsening Loss, Announces a Sweeping Plan to Cut 10,000 Jobs

snippet: Changing direction, Time Inc. will now work along with Apple to put its magazines on tablets and other devices.
abstract: Time Inc will make all of its magazines available via the newsstand section of Apple's App Store; firm was once the magazine industry's most ardent opponent of selling subscriptions through Apple.

headline.main: Time Inc. to Sell Its Magazines on Apple’s Newsstand
headline.print_headline: Time Inc. to Sell Its Magazines on Apple’s Newsstand

snippet: Zhang Ziyi, sued Apple Daily, a well-known tabloid newspaper, and Next Magazine Publishing, over articles saying she was paid to have sex with Bo Xilai, the deposed Communist Party official.
abstract: Zhang Ziyi, one of China’s most famous actresses, files a libel suit against two prominent Hong Kong news organizations over articles saying she was paid to have sex with Bo Xilai, the deposed Communist Party official

headline.main: China: Actress Sues Publications Over Bo Allegations
headline.print_headline: China: Actress Sues Publications Over Bo Allegations

snippet: The new App Smart columnist describes some apps now on his home screen: photography apps, games, and a text translator that may offer a glimpse of the future.
abstract: Kip Eaton, the new App Smart columnist, describes some of his favorite smartphone and tablet apps.

headline.main: For Starters, These Are a Few of My Favorite Apps
headline.print_headline: For Starters, These Are a Few of My Favorite Apps
